column1: Long-term use of alcohol increases your chances of: - Bleeding from the stomach or esophagus (the tube the food travels through from your mouth to your stomach).
- Cancer of the esophagus, liver, colon, head and neck, breasts, and other areas.
Even responsible drinking can lead to high blood pressure in some people.
- Using alcohol for a long time can lead to high blood pressure, which can then cause the heart to weaken and become enlarged.
Damage to nerves from alcohol use can cause many problems, including - Numbness or a painful "pins and needles" feeling in your arms or legs.
But alcohol can: - Make these problems worse over time - Cause sleep problems or make them worse - Increase the risk of suicide Families are often affected when someone in the home uses alcohol.
